title: CURRENT STATE OF ARAM
body:
With the introduction of snowball and how it brings melee back into the game, I'm having a few issues with ARAM atm. I tend to only play ARAM due to time constraints and find that rift lasts too long.

Obviously keep in mind that player skill is always an issue I think that the penalty of dying in ARAM early game needs to be harder. Too many players will dive or snowball dive for a kill only for themselves to get killed. Although I know getting to gold from the kill is good I do think that with harsher time penalties or even maybe losing the gold if you die within 5 secs of a kill that it would make the game more objective based i.e. instead of getting that kill and dying yourself get a few shots on the turret and get out.

maybe I'm just a whiny bitch but I figured as a 1500 game plus player of ARAM there must be others out there who see this too

replies.body: Trading 1 for 1 on aram is often good, especially if you are already low or have a lot of unspent gold. It always irks me seeing teammates burning flashes to escape on a couple hundred hp only to stand around being useless for the next several minutes because they are too low to do anything, or playing super far back on a poke champion when they have no mana and 3k unspent gold and no items. Dying late game after you've won a teamfight can also be beneficial if you have no way to heal up, otherwise you will be at a significant disadvantage for next fight.

although you make good points the mana issue is always more so about what someone bought first. If your a heavy range poker and don't buy a mana item to start then your asking to be useless 2 mins into the game. aram is about sustained pressure its a tug of war.

still my point remains that there needs to be more loss for dying early game
